summary: Happy Father’s Day, Tony Stark! For 11 years he showed me what it means to be a good man and, in the end, a Great man. To always...
body: Happy Father’s Day, Tony Stark! For 11 years he showed me what it means to be a good man and, in the end, a Great man. To always be improving, growing, and evolving. To take care of those around me and do the best I could for anyone within my reach. To contribute what I could, and value what others bring to the table. He taught me what it means to be strong enough to face your weaknesses. What it looks like to be incredibly human. He taught me to always do my best. More importantly, he taught me that when my best isn’t good enough I shouldn’t quit but instead do my best in a different way. Tony wasn’t perfect. He wasn’t the god of anything. He didn’t have any special enhancements. He was The Real Hero.

summary: IronDad & SpiderSon Prompt: Are You My Son?
body:
IronDad & SpiderSon Prompt: Are You My Son?

Absolutely No Endgame here!

A small group of Hydra Agents had been on the rise, the Avengers were sent to take them down. Unfortunately, Tony did not survive, he was killed in battle. 

However, what no one knew was that the same Hydra Agents had taken Tony’s body and experimented on him, alive! But something went wrong, and their asset came out more powerful than they had anticipated. Tony had gained Technopatical powers, and his eyes glowed a cold shade of blue. With his new power, he killed every single one of the Hydra Agents.

He was no longer Tony Stark.

Several weeks later in New York, a genetically enhanced man that calls himself “The Mechanic” was causing mayhem, stealing pieces of technology and leaving a trail of bodies in his path.

The Avengers begged Peter to stay out of it and let them handle it… but clearly they didn’t know him better. He couldn’t just sit behind, and let another child lose his father.

Spider-Man had managed to corner the Mechanic in an abandoned building and had managed to web one of his hands down, (geez this feels familiar). But when he caught sight of his face-

“No. Oh God, it can’t be! He can’t be alive!” Peter thought as he took off his mask without thinking, tears streaming down his face. “Mr. Stark?”

When the Mechanic caught sight of the young spiderling with his mask off, something in his brain went off, a familiar yet unidentifiable feeling that he didn’t understand.

Who was this kid? Why does he look so familiar? Maybe he’s the key to his past? In that moment of realization, the Mechanic did the only logical thing:

He kidnaps him.

Peter woke up in a room on a cozy bed, and dressed in a loose sweatsuit. The room was bare and he could tell that the large steel door could only be opened from the outside.

Mr. Stark, or rather The Mechanic, had brought Peter to his secluded home, where no one can find them. And makes it very clear that he has no intention on letting his new guest go.

The Mechanic even went as far as to send a threatening message to the Avengers, “If you or the police so much as think about finding me or try to take Spider-Boy away, I will burn this entire city to the ground, and leave you to watch the ashes,”

Peter knows he should escape, he knows he has to… but he can’t leave Mr. Stark broken like this. Even if he’s not Mr. Stark anymore, he can’t abandon him.

Besides, the new Mr. Stark isn’t mean to him but he does get a little scary when angry. Like at first when Peter first refused to eat, or begged to go home. Then to when he even mentioned the Avengers or asked him to consider returning home.

“You are not going anywhere! Not until I find out why I can’t seem to get you out of my fucking head! Why are you so damn important to me?”

tags: i have not watched endgame but i heard something happens to iron man and it's breaking my heart
summary: Happy Father's day to:
body:
Happy Father’s day to:

Robert Downey Jr, a.k.a. Tony Stark

Once, I had a dream that I met Robert Downey Jr at an airport. For some reason, I kept calling him “Sir!” and I remember complaining to him about what happened to Iron Man (I think I was talking about the Avengers endgame trailer when he was stuck in space). He just laughed it off.

The next thing I knew, he had some free time and wanted to chill out with me. So, we went to this random store and we were skimming through the aisles, chatting. We stopped at one aisle with plushies and we talked about which ones we wanted (I wanted Kirby).

We finished shopping and returned to the airport. I remembered telling him something about how people had mistreated me and he got annoyed. I told him I had brushed aside their comments and it didn’t bother me anymore. I can’t remember what he said, but I knew it was something like they didn’t realise what they’re missing out on.

What struck me about this dream, was that it felt like we were friends and that we knew each other for a while. It warmed my heart that this famous guy genuinely cared about me, even though we just met.

The point is, I realised that he’s the kind of father figure I wanted. Someone who would treat me like a friend. Who cared about how I felt and would shut down anyone who thought otherwise.

Yes, Robert Downey Jr had a rough past. But look at him now. You can’t deny how much he wants to help people out.

In the marvel movies, as Tony Stark, we know how much he hates his father, who was distant and cold towards him. But he didn’t adopt his father’s behaviour, but instead acted the way he wanted his father to act. To love him.

Not only is he a father in real life, but you can tell he puts his fatherly persona into his character. You see his interactions with Spiderman and it just warms your heart. And don’t remind me of that painful scene in Infinity war. If that doesn’t spell out their father-son relationship, I don’t know what will.

I will always admire Robert Downey Jr. Not just because he’s Tony Stark, but because he chose to change his life for the better. He’s proven that your past doesn’t have to define you or hold you back. And maybe one day, it’ll be the same for me.

Happy father’s Day, Robert Downey Jr.

We finished shopping and returned to the airport. I remembered telling him something about how people had mistreated me and he got annoyed. I told him I had brushed aside their comments and it didn’t bother me anymore. I can’t remember what he said, but I knew it was something like they didn’t realise what they’re missing out on.

What struck me about this dream, was that it felt like we were friends and that we knew each other for a while. It warmed my heart that this famous guy genuinely cared about me, even though we just met.

The point is, I realised that he’s the kind of father figure I wanted. Someone who would treat me like a friend. Who cared about how I felt and would shut down anyone who thought otherwise.

Yes, Robert Downey Jr had a rough past. But look at him now. You can’t deny how much he wants to help people out.

In the marvel movies, as Tony Stark, we know how much he hates his father, who was distant and cold towards him. But he didn’t adopt his father’s behaviour, but instead acted the way he wanted his father to act. To love him.

Not only is he a father in real life, but you can tell he puts his fatherly persona into his character. You see his interactions with Spiderman and it just warms your heart. And don’t remind me of that painful scene in Infinity war. If that doesn’t spell out their father-son relationship, I don’t know what will.

I will always admire Robert Downey Jr. Not just because he’s Tony Stark, but because he chose to change his life for the better. He’s proven that your past doesn’t have to define you or hold you back. And maybe one day, it’ll be the same for me.

Happy father’s Day, Robert Downey Jr.
trail.content:
Happy Father’s day to:

Robert Downey Jr, a.k.a. Tony Stark

Once, I had a dream that I met Robert Downey Jr at an airport. For some reason, I kept calling him “Sir!” and I remember complaining to him about what happened to Iron Man (I think I was talking about the Avengers endgame trailer when he was stuck in space). He just laughed it off.

The next thing I knew, he had some free time and wanted to chill out with me. So, we went to this random store and we were skimming through the aisles, chatting. We stopped at one aisle with plushies and we talked about which ones we wanted (I wanted Kirby).

We finished shopping and returned to the airport. I remembered telling him something about how people had mistreated me and he got annoyed. I told him I had brushed aside their comments and it didn’t bother me anymore. I can’t remember what he said, but I knew it was something like they didn’t realise what they’re missing out on.

What struck me about this dream, was that it felt like we were friends and that we knew each other for a while. It warmed my heart that this famous guy genuinely cared about me, even though we just met.

The point is, I realised that he’s the kind of father figure I wanted. Someone who would treat me like a friend. Who cared about how I felt and would shut down anyone who thought otherwise.

Yes, Robert Downey Jr had a rough past. But look at him now. You can’t deny how much he wants to help people out.

In the marvel movies, as Tony Stark, we know how much he hates his father, who was distant and cold towards him. But he didn’t adopt his father’s behaviour, but instead acted the way he wanted his father to act. To love him.

Not only is he a father in real life, but you can tell he puts his fatherly persona into his character. You see his interactions with Spiderman and it just warms your heart. And don’t remind me of that painful scene in Infinity war. If that doesn’t spell out their father-son relationship, I don’t know what will.

I will always admire Robert Downey Jr. Not just because he’s Tony Stark, but because he chose to change his life for the better. He’s proven that your past doesn’t have to define you or hold you back. And maybe one day, it’ll be the same for me.

Happy father’s Day, Robert Downey Jr.

summary: You Make Me So Hot
title: You Make Me So Hot
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2XZcKdf

by sunlights

“You will be sharing it with Harley, right?” Tony had asked three weeks ago, after Peter’s doctor gave him a timeline when the heat symptoms would first appear and when he heat would hit.

Peter was sure he whole body as red, he didn’t simply blush, he felt like his body was on fire, “Yes.” He finally managed to reply and Tony smiled kindly.

Or: Peter is presenting and going into his first heat and he shares it with Harley. Smut and fluff issues.<

summary: The difference between Iron Man and some other movies is that there’s no spider bite; there’s no magic bullet where a hero is...
caption: The difference between Iron Man and some other movies is that there’s no spider bite; there’s no magic bullet where a hero is born. We had to build him. We wanted people to remember that there’s a person inside that suit, and it will hurt if he falls. (x)

reblog.comment: The difference between Iron Man and some other movies is that there’s no spider bite; there’s no magic bullet where a hero is born. We had to build him. We wanted people to remember that there’s a person inside that suit, and it will hurt if he falls. (x)

blog.name: ixlovexirondad
blog.title: Iron-Dad
blog.description: I just post and re-post a bunch of irondad things. Tell me what to write and I will write it.

summary: Cats
body:
Cats

Peters always wanted a cat, but Aunt May is allergic to them, so they never got one. Now that he basically lived in the tower with Tony he had an idea.

“Mr. Stark?” Peter just got back from patrolling after saving a little boys cat from a tree.

“Yeah, kiddo?” Tony was working on something in his lab but Peter wasn’t paying any attention to what it was.

“You know how I love cats but I never got one. And I know you say you hate cats and all but I know Pepper loves them…” Tony knew what was coming so he stopped him before he rambles on too much.

“You want a cat? Like you just said, I hate cats. I’ve always hated cats. We’re not getting a cat.”

“Please?” Peter flashes his puppy dog eyes. They almost always worked on Tony but not this time.

“I said no kid.” Tony tried not sounding too mean but still firm. “Now come help me with this, I need your small fingers.”

Peter ignored the cat thing mostly, other than a few subtle “Your stressed? Studies show petting cats relieve stress.” and “Cat purrs actually help healing.”

The next day went by slow for Peter, he couldn’t do what he wanted to do until after school. Finally the bell rang, he ran outside and to the animal shelter, he had to go quickly because Mr. Stark would worry if he took to long but he had to fine the perfect one.

Shadow but cute but didn’t seem to like being picked up or socializing in general.

Buddy was cute too but was sleeping the whole time and didn’t seem like he would do much other than sleep and Peter wanted a more active one.

Mr. Whiskers seemed a little too hyper, jumping around and meowing a bunch.

Peter thought there wasn’t going to be the one until he found her. She didn’t have a name yet but he thought of a perfect one as soon as he saw her. She was perfect. She was a reddish-orange with two bright blue eyes, she even had a white patch of fur on her chest, and she was so, so fluffy. She was sitting there licking her paw and he asked the worker if he could hold her. She was calm and let him pick her up.

He knew she was the one.

He got her and brought her to the tower after picking the name. When pepper saw her she fell in love. “Tony, said you could get a cat?”

“Well, not exactly. I thought maybe if he saw her he would like her.”

“Well lets go show him”



“You got a cat?!” Tong was angry but Peter could sense something else too. “I said no cats!”

“Tony, the kid wanted a cat. Let him keep her. I mean look how cute she is!” Pepper held her up.

“What did you say it’s name was?”

“Her name is,” Pepper looked at Peter then to the cat then to Tony. “Iron-Cat aka Tiny Stark ”

“Iron-Cat? Tiny Stark? Are you serious? You named it Iron-Cat?” Peter was impressed with himself with his play on words.

Peter was silent knowing Mr. Stark was angry. “What else? She’s red, has blue eyes, and even has a white patch on her chest.”

“My arc-reactor is blue”

“Cats don’t come in blue” Peter spoke up.

Tony chuckled “alright let me see this Iron-Crap” he faked coughed “I mean Iron-Cat.”

Pepper smirked and handed her to Tony. “She smells.”

“We just got her, she needs a bath.” Tony set her down.

“Who’s gonna feed her and clean the litter box?”

“I will” Peter didn’t want to clean out a litter box but he would for Iron-Cat.

“Whatever, but she’s not aloud in the lab.”

“Okay!” Peter was thrilled he could keep her.


Over the next few days Peter could tell Mr. Stark liked her. He saw him pet her when he thought no one was looking and even saw him talk to her once. It was movie night and they were sitting on the couch when Iron-Cat jumped up and Peter could see Mr. Stark wanted to pet her. “Mr. Stark, I’ve seen you pet her, I know you like her, you can pet her.”

“What?! No I don’t. I hate cats.” It was silent for a moment while Peter and Pepper looked at Tony. He finally gave in picked up Iron-Cat and she stared to purr. “Assholes. Play the movie

“I knew you liked her”

“Well lets go show him”



“You got a cat?!” Tong was angry but Peter could sense something else too. “I said no cats!”

“Tony, the kid wanted a cat. Let him keep her. I mean look how cute she is!” Pepper held her up.

“What did you say it’s name was?”

“Her name is,” Pepper looked at Peter then to the cat then to Tony. “Iron-Cat aka Tiny Stark ”

“Iron-Cat? Tiny Stark? Are you serious? You named it Iron-Cat?” Peter was impressed with himself with his play on words.

Peter was silent knowing Mr. Stark was angry. “What else? She’s red, has blue eyes, and even has a white patch on her chest.”

“My arc-reactor is blue”

“Cats don’t come in blue” Peter spoke up.

Tony chuckled “alright let me see this Iron-Crap” he faked coughed “I mean Iron-Cat.”

Pepper smirked and handed her to Tony. “She smells.”

“We just got her, she needs a bath.” Tony set her down.

“Who’s gonna feed her and clean the litter box?”

“I will” Peter didn’t want to clean out a litter box but he would for Iron-Cat.

“Whatever, but she’s not aloud in the lab.”

“Okay!” Peter was thrilled he could keep her.


Over the next few days Peter could tell Mr. Stark liked her. He saw him pet her when he thought no one was looking and even saw him talk to her once. It was movie night and they were sitting on the couch when Iron-Cat jumped up and Peter could see Mr. Stark wanted to pet her. “Mr. Stark, I’ve seen you pet her, I know you like her, you can pet her.”

“What?! No I don’t. I hate cats.” It was silent for a moment while Peter and Pepper looked at Tony. He finally gave in picked up Iron-Cat and she stared to purr. “Assholes. Play the movie

“I knew you liked her”
